lexUnit.name: require.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: have a believe that some object or state is necessary for some other (desirable) state to obtain.

sentence.text: However , a contrary trend of rapid increase in the number of ` elderly severely mentally ill patients requiring hospital care " was discovered .
Indeed , the same patient may require more than one remedy at different stages of the treatment programme .
He required some music to accompany the hymns , and Miss Catherine Metcalfe of Bainbridge obliged with her accordion .
Thus most long-term care for people who require a lot of daily support would be the responsibility of the local authority rather than , as formerly , of the NHS .
Phenothiazine treatment will be required for the patient with an acute schizophrenic illness .
` The husband too will require attention .
Eight patients have required emergency surgery coinciding with the unrestricted reintroduction of food after remission induced by diet .
McKimmie , who required surgery , could be necessary since Paul Mason , Lee Richardson and Gary Smith are all victims of flu .
` Will you require any assistance ? " asked Herr Bischoff as he handed his Russian client a personal sealed envelope .
Funds are urgently required if this work is to be completed on the North Side .
Britain urgently requires a mechanism for influencing the policies and behaviour of its police .
Jimmy Warren was indeed in a state of shock at what he had witnessed and Rachel knew that he would require post-incident-trauma counselling .
` Most patients do n't require any treatment , but occasionally bites become infected and we have to intervene . "
He requires no treatment other than rest .
At present I require assistance to help me to choose the most suitable occupation .
